hero.title: Welcome to Innovate QA Conference 2026
hero.subtitle: Join industry leaders, pioneers, and visionaries sharing insights, best practices, and cutting-edge tools to build high-quality, safe, accessible, and reliable systems.

features.title: Community & Connection
features.description: We bring together QA professionals, engineering leaders, and innovators to share knowledge, build networks, and support one another in advancing the discipline of quality.

features.title: Learning & Growth
features.description: Through conferences, workshops, and meetups, we provide hands-on learning opportunities focused on modern testing practices, AI in QA, and practical strategies to elevate your skills and career.

features.title: Shaping the Future of Quality
features.description: We help teams and leaders embrace transformation—integrating AI, automation, and lean testing approaches to build high-confidence release pipelines.

features.title: AI-Powered Testing
features.description: Discover how artificial intelligence is revolutionizing test automation, defect prediction, and quality analytics to accelerate your delivery pipeline.

features.title: Engineering Excellence
features.description: Learn from practitioners who build quality into every stage of the development process, from code reviews to production monitoring.

features.title: Industry Networking
features.description: Connect with peers from leading tech companies, share experiences, and build relationships that advance your career.

features.title: Hands-On Workshops
features.description: Participate in practical sessions where you'll learn new tools, techniques, and frameworks you can apply immediately.

features.title: Career Advancement
features.description: Gain insights from industry leaders on how to grow your career, lead teams, and make an impact in quality engineering.

venue.name: The Westin Bellevue
venue.description: Join us at The Westin Bellevue in downtown Bellevue, Washington.

features.text: Downtown Bellevue, accessible from I-405 and I-90

featured.name: Carlos Arguelles
featured.title: Senior Principal Engineer
featured.topic: The Evolution of the Testing Roles
featured.bio:
Carlos Arguelles has 27 years of experience working in various aspects of Developer Productivity Engineering at Amazon, Google, and Microsoft. He served as a Technical Lead for company-wide Infrastructure for Integration Testing at Amazon for 6 years and held the same position at Google for 4 years.

Carlos is passionate about Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery and Core Developer Infrastructure for mid-to-large software companies. Having spent nearly three decades at three of the largest software companies in the world, he has seen firsthand how hundreds of thousands of developers write, review, test, and deploy code at a large scale. At these large companies, small inefficiencies can accumulate, leading to developer fatigue and the loss of millions—or even hundreds of millions—of dollars in productivity or wasted hardware resources. Carlos is dedicated to improving engineers' lives by removing toil, enhancing efficiency, and raising the bar in engineering and operational excellence.

Carlos shares stories about his experiences at Amazon, Google, and Microsoft on his blog. You can follow him on LinkedIn.

featured.name: Jason Huggins
featured.title: Founder and CEO
featured.topic: Testing on 7 Billion Mobile Phones: A Modest Proposal
featured.bio: In 2015, Jason Huggins founded Tapster Robotics in Oak Park, Illinois. At Tapster, Jason combines his unique automated testing experience with a lifelong enthusiasm for robotics. Jason also started the popular open-source test automation projects Selenium and Appium. In 2013, Jason Huggins was a member of President Obama's "tech surge" team tasked with fixing the troubled HealthCare.gov site. Prior to starting Tapster, Jason was founder and CTO at Sauce Labs and an automation engineer at Google.

featured.name: Siri Varma Vegiraju
featured.title: Security Tech Lead
featured.topic: Testing LLM-Powered APIs: Challenges, Strategies, and Best Practices
featured.bio:
Siri Varma Vegiraju is a seasoned expert in healthcare, cloud computing, and security. Currently, he focuses on securing Azure Cloud workloads, leveraging his extensive experience in distributed systems and real-time streaming solutions. Prior to his current role, Siri contributed significantly to cloud observability platforms and multi-cloud environments.

He has demonstrated his expertise through notable achievements in various competitive events and as a judge and technical reviewer for leading publications. Siri frequently speaks at industry conferences on topics related to Cloud and Security and holds a Masters Degree from University of Texas, Arlington with a specialization in Computer Science.

eventLD.name: Innovate QA 2026
eventLD.description: Join industry leaders and pioneers at Innovate QA Conference 2026 in Seattle. Share insights, best practices, and cutting-edge tools for quality engineering excellence.
